s.text: An important question for researchers is to establish whether dementia incidence, prevalence, and national history vary from one location to another.
An important question for researchers is to establish whether dementia incidence, prevalence, and national history vary from one location to another.
An important question for researchers is to establish whether dementia incidence, prevalence, and national history vary from one location to another.
An important question for researchers is to establish whether dementia incidence, prevalence, and national history vary from one location to another.

A high proportion of dementia patients are thought to have a vascular component to their dementia, and it has been assumed that dementia incidence could be reduced if vascular risk were better controlled.
Risk factors for other chronic disorders common in old age (notably cardiovascular disease and cancers) do vary in their prevalence between and within countries.
